1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		locate_module.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description: 	Contains the routines which locate the actual	     **
14   |  **			modulefile given a modulefilename by looking in all  **
15   |  **			of the paths in MODULEPATH. 			     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		Locate_ModuleFile				     **
18   |  **			SortedDirList					     **
19   |  **			SplitIntoList					     **
20   |  **			FreeList					     **
21   |  **			SourceRC					     **
22   |  **			SourceVers					     **
23   |  ** 									     **
24   |  **   Notes:								     **
25   |  ** 									     **
26   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
27   |  ****/
28   | 
29   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
30   |  ** 									     **
31   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
32   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
33   |  ** 									     ** 
34   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
35   | 
36   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: locate_module.c.src.html,v 1.6 2006/01/18 05:35:11 rkowen Exp $";
37   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };

53   | /** ************************************************************************ **/

55   | #define	SRCFRAG	100

57   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
58   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
59   | /** ************************************************************************ **/

66   | 
67   | static	char	module_name[] = "locate_module.c";	/** File name of this module **/
68   | 
69   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
70   | static	char	_proc_Locate_ModuleFile[] = "Locate_ModuleFile";
71   | #endif
72   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
73   | static	char	_proc_GetModuleName[] = "GetModuleName";
74   | #endif
75   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
76   | static	char	_proc_SortedDirList[] = "SortedDirList";
77   | static	char	_proc_SplitIntoList[] = "SplitIntoList";
78   | #endif
79   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
80   | static	char	_proc_FreeList[] = "FreeList";
81   | #endif
82   | 
83   | static	char	buf[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
84   | static	char	modfil_buf[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
85   | 
86   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
87   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
88   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
89   | 
90   | static	int	  filename_compare( const void*, const void*);
91   | static	char	 *GetModuleName( Tcl_Interp*, char*, char*, char*);
92   | 
93   | /*++++
94   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
95   |  ** 									     **
96   |  **   Function:		filename_compare				     **
97   |  ** 									     **
98   |  **   Description: 	This is a reverse compare function to reverse the    **
99   |  **			filename list. The function is used as compare func- **
100  |  **			tion for qsort.					     **
101  |  ** 									     **
102  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
103  |  ** 									     **
104  |  **   Parameters:	const void	*fi1	First filename to compare    **
105  |  **			const void	*fi2	Second filename to compare   **
106  |  ** 									     **
107  |  **   Result:		int	-1	filename 1 > filename 2		     **
108  |  **				0	filename 1 == filename 2	     **
109  |  **				1	filename 1 < filename 2		     **
110  |  ** 									     **
111  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
112  |  ** 									     **
113  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
114  |  ++++*/
115  | 
116  | static int  filename_compare(	const void	*fi1,
117  | 				const void	*fi2)
118  | {
119  |     return strcmp(*(char**)fi2, *(char**)fi1);
120  | }
121  | 
122  | /*++++
123  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
124  |  ** 									     **
125  |  **   Function:		Locate_ModuleFile				     **
126  |  ** 									     **
127  |  **   Description:	Searches for a modulefile given a string argument    **
128  |  **			which is either a full path or a modulefile name     **
129  |  **			-- usually the argument the user gave. If it's not a **
130  |  **			full path, the directories in the MODULESPATH	     **
131  |  **			environment variable are searched to find a match    **
132  |  **			for the given name.				     **
133  |  ** 									     **
134  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
135  |  ** 									     **
136  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl interpr.**
137  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module to**
138  |  **							be located	     **
139  |  **			char		*realname	Real modulename (with**
140  |  **							version)	     **
141  |  **			char		*filename	Real    full module  **
142  |  **							file path	     **
143  |  ** 									     **
144  |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK or TCL_ERROR		     **
145  |  **			filename	the full path of the required module **
146  |  **					file is copied in here		     **
147  |  ** 									     **
148  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
149  |  **						by the current command	     **
150  |  ** 									     **
151  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
152  |  ++++*/
153  | 
154  | int Locate_ModuleFile(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
155  |                   	char		*modulename,
156  |                   	char		*realname,
157  |                   	char		*filename)
158  | {
159  |     char	*p;			/** Tokenization pointer	     **/
160  |     char	*result = NULL;		/** This functions result	     **/
161  |     char	**pathlist;		/** List of paths to scan	     **/
162  |     int		  numpaths,		/** Size of this list		     **/
163  |     		  i;			/** Loop counter		     **/
164  |     char	*modulespath;		/** Buffer for the contents of the   **/
165  | 					/** environment variable MODULEPATH  **/
166  |     char	*mod, *vers;		/** Module and version name for sym- **/
167  | 					/** bolic name lookup		     **/
168  |     /**
169  |      **  If it is a full path name, that's the module file to load.
170  |      **/
171  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
172  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Locate_ModuleFile, "modulename = '",
173  | 	modulename, "'", NULL);
174  | #endif
175  | 
176  |     if( !modulename) 
177  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, "modulename", NULL))
178  | 	    goto unwind0;
179  | 	
180  |     if( modulename[0] == '/' || modulename[0] == '.') {
181  | 
182  | 	p = (char*) strrchr( modulename, '/');
183  |         if(p) {
184  |             *p = '\0';
185  | 	    /**
186  | 	     **  Check, if what has been specified is a valid version of
187  | 	     **  the specified module ...
188  | 	     **/
189  |             if((char *) NULL ==
190  | 		(result = GetModuleName(interp, modulename, NULL,(p+1)))) 
191  | 		goto unwind0;
192  | 	    /**
193  | 	     **  Reinstall the 'modulefile' which has been corrupted by
194  | 	     **   tokenization
195  | 	     **/
196  | 	    *p = '/';
197  | 	    /**
198  | 	     **  Reinstall the 'modulefile' which has been corrupted by
199  | 	     **  tokenization
200  | 	     **/
201  | 	    *p = '/';
202  | 
203  | 	    /**
204  | 	     **  ... Looks good! Conditionally (if there has been no version
205  | 	     **  specified) we have to add the default version
206  | 	     **/
207  |             if( !strcmp((p + 1), result)) {
208  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
209  | 		modulename, NULL))
210  | 		    goto unwind1;
211  |             } else {
212  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
213  | 		modulename,"/",result, NULL))
214  | 		    goto unwind1;
215  |             }
216  |         } else {
217  | 	    /**
218  | 	     **  Hmm! There's no backslash in 'modulename'. So it MUST begin
219  | 	     **  on '.' and MUST be part of the current directory
220  | 	     **/
221  |             if( NULL == (result = GetModuleName( interp, modulename, NULL,
222  | 		modulename)))
223  | 		goto unwind0;
224  | 	
225  |             if( !strcmp( modulename, result) ||
226  | 		(strlen( modulename) + 1 + strlen( result) + 1 > MOD_BUFSIZE)) {
227  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
228  | 		modulename, NULL))
229  | 		    goto unwind1;
230  |             } else {
231  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
232  | 		modulename,"/",result, NULL))
233  | 		    goto unwind1;
234  |             }
235  |         }
236  |     /**
237  |      **  So it is not a full path name what has been specified. Scan the 
238  |      **  MODULESPATH
239  |      **/
240  |     } else {
241  | 	/**
242  | 	 **  If I don't find a path in MODULEPATH, there's nothing to search.
243  | 	 **/
244  | 	if( !( modulespath = (char *) getenv( "MODULEPATH"))) {
245  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL)) {
246  | 		g_current_module = NULL;
247  | 		goto unwind0;
248  | 	    }
249  | 	}
250  | 	/**
251  | 	 ** strip off any extraneous new lines
252  | 	 **/
253  | 	{ char *end;
254  | 	if ((char *) NULL != (end = strrchr(modulespath, '\n'))) *end = '\0';
255  | 	}
256  | 	/**
257  | 	 **  Expand the module name (in case it is a symbolic one). This must
258  | 	 **  be done once here in order to expand any aliases
259  | 	 **/
260  | 	if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod, &vers)) {
261  | 	    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
262  | 	    mod,"/",vers, NULL))
263  | 		goto unwind0;
264  | 	    modulename = buf;
265  | 	}
266  | 	/**
267  | 	 **  Split up the MODULEPATH values into multiple directories
268  | 	 **/
269  | 	if( NULL == (pathlist = SplitIntoList(interp, modulespath, &numpaths)))
270  | 	    goto unwind0;
271  | 	/**
272  | 	 **  Check each directory to see if it contains the module
273  | 	 **/
274  | 	for(i=0; i<numpaths; i++) {
275  | 	    if( NULL != (result = GetModuleName( interp, pathlist[i], NULL,
276  | 		modulename))) {
277  | 
278  | 		if( strlen( pathlist[i]) + 2 + strlen( result) > MOD_BUFSIZE) {
279  | 		    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
280  | 		    pathlist[i], NULL))
281  | 			goto unwind1;
282  | 		} else {
283  | 		    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
284  | 		    pathlist[i],"/",result, NULL))
285  | 			goto unwind1;
286  | 		}
287  | 		break;
288  | 	    }
289  | 	    /**
290  | 	     **  If we havn't found it, we should try to re-expand the module
291  | 	     **  name, because some rc file have been sourced
292  | 	     **/
293  | 	    if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod, &vers)) {
294  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
295  | 		mod,"/",vers, NULL))
296  | 		    goto unwind1;
297  | 		modulename = buf;
298  | 	    }
299  | 	} /** for **/
300  | 	/**
301  | 	 **  Free the memory created from the call to SplitIntoList()
302  | 	 **/
303  | 	FreeList( pathlist, numpaths);
304  | 	/**
305  | 	 **  If result still NULL, then we really never found it and we should
306  | 	 **  return ERROR and clear the full_path array for cleanliness.
307  | 	 **/
308  | 	if( !result) {
309  | 	    filename[0] = '\0';
310  | 	    goto unwind0;
311  | 	}
312  |     } /** not a full path name **/	
313  |     /**
314  |      **  Free up what has been allocated and pass the result back to
315  |      **  the caller and save the real module file name returned by
316  |      **  GetModuleName
317  |      **/
318  |     strncpy( realname, result, MOD_BUFSIZE);
319  |     if ((char *) NULL == stringer( realname, MOD_BUFSIZE, result, NULL))
320  | 	goto unwind1;
321  |     null_free((void *) &result);
322  | 
323  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
324  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_Locate_ModuleFile, NULL);
325  | #endif
326  | 
327  |     return( TCL_OK);
328  | 
329  | unwind1:
330  |     null_free((void *) &result);
331  | unwind0:
332  |     return( TCL_ERROR);
333  | }
334  | 
335  | /*++++
336  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
337  |  ** 									     **
338  |  **   Function:		GetModuleName					     **
339  |  ** 									     **
340  |  **   Description:	Given a path and a module filename, this function    **
341  |  **			checks to find the modulefile.			     **
342  |  ** 									     **
343  |  **   Notes:		This function is RECURSIVE			     **
344  |  **									     **
345  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
346  |  ** 									     **
347  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
348  |  **			char		*path		Path to start seeking**
349  |  **			char		*prefix		Module name prefix   **
350  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module   **
351  |  ** 									     **
352  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL	Any failure( parameters, alloc)	     **
353  |  **				else	Pointer to an allocated buffer con-  **
354  |  **					taining the complete module file path**
355  |  ** 									     **
356  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
357  |  ** 									     **
358  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
359  |  ++++*/
360  | 
361  | static	char	*GetModuleName(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
362  | 			     	char		*path,
363  | 				char		*prefix,
364  | 			     	char		*modulename)
365  | {
366  |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
367  |     char	 *fullpath = NULL;	/** Buffer for creating path names   **/
368  |     char	 *Result = NULL;	/** Our return value		     **/
369  |     char	**filelist = NULL;	/** Buffer for a list of possible    **/
370  | 					/** module files		     **/
371  |     int		  numlist;		/** Size of this list		     **/
372  |     int		  i, slen, is_def;
373  |     char	 *s, *t;		/** Private string buffer	     **/
374  |     char	 *mod, *ver;		/** Pointer to module and version    **/
375  |     char	 *mod1, *ver1;		/** Temp pointer		     **/
376  |     
377  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
378  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_GetModuleName, NULL);
379  | #endif
380  |     /**
381  |      **  Split the modulename into module and version. Use a private buffer
382  |      **  for this
383  |      **/
384  |     if((char *) NULL == (s = stringer(NULL, 0,  modulename, NULL))) {
385  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
386  | 	goto unwind0;
387  |     }
388  |     slen = strlen( s) + 1;
389  |     mod = s;
390  |     if( ver = strchr( mod, '/'))
391  | 	*ver++ = '\0';
392  |     /**
393  |      **  Allocate a buffer for full pathname building
394  |      **/
395  |     if((char *) NULL == (fullpath = stringer(NULL, MOD_BUFSIZE, NULL))) {
396  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL)) {
397  | 	    goto unwind1;
398  | 	}
399  |     }
400  |     /**
401  |      **  Check whether $path/$prefix/$mod is a directory
402  |      **/
403  |     if( prefix) {
404  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
405  | 	path,"/",prefix,"/",mod, NULL))
406  | 	    goto unwind1;
407  |     } else {
408  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
409  | 	path,"/",mod, NULL))
410  | 	    goto unwind1;
411  |     }
412  |     is_def = !strcmp( mod, _default);
413  | 
414  |     if( is_def || !stat( fullpath, &stats)) {
415  | 	/**
416  | 	 **  If it is a directory
417  | 	 **/
418  |     	if( !is_def && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
419  | 	    /**
420  | 	     **  Source the ".modulerc" file if it exists
421  | 	     **  For compatibility source the .version file, too
422  | 	     **/
423  | 	    if( prefix) {
424  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer(modfil_buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
425  | 		path,"/",mod, NULL))
426  | 		    goto unwind2;
427  | 	    } else {
428  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer(modfil_buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,mod, NULL))
429  | 		    goto unwind2;
430  | 	    }
431  | 
432  | 	    if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
433  | 	    path,"/",modfil_buf, NULL))
434  | 		goto unwind2;
435  | 	    g_current_module = modfil_buf;
436  | 
437  | 	    if( TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, fullpath, modulerc_file) ||
438  | 		TCL_ERROR == SourceVers( interp, fullpath, modfil_buf)) {
439  | 		/* flags = save_flags; */
440  | 		    goto unwind2;
441  | 	    }
442  | 	    /**
443  | 	     **  After sourcing the RC files, we have to look up versions again
444  | 	     **/
445  | 	    if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod1, &ver1)) {
446  | 		int len = strlen( mod1) + strlen( ver1) + 2;
447  | 		/**
448  | 		 **  Maybe we have to enlarge s
449  | 		 **/
450  | 		if( len > slen) {
451  | 		    null_free((void *) &s);
452  | 		    if((char *) NULL == (s = stringer( NULL, len, NULL))) {
453  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
454  | 			goto unwind2;
455  | 		    }
456  | 		    slen = len;
457  | 		}
458  | 		/**
459  | 		 **  Print the new module/version in the buffer
460  | 		 **/
461  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer( s, len, mod1,"/", ver1, NULL)) {
462  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
463  | 		    goto unwind2;
464  | 		}
465  | 		mod = s;
466  | 		if( ver = strchr( s, '/'))
467  | 		    *ver++ = '\0';
468  | 	    }
469  | 	    /**
470  | 	     **  recursively delve into subdirectories (until ver == NULL).
471  | 	     **/
472  | 	    if( ver) {
473  | 		int len = strlen( mod) + 1;
474  | 
475  | 		if( prefix)
476  | 		    len += strlen( prefix) +1;
477  | 		/**
478  | 		 **  Build the new prefix
479  | 		 **/
480  | 		if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, len, NULL))) {
481  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
482  | 		    goto unwind2;
483  | 		}
484  | 
485  | 		if( prefix) {
486  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t, len, prefix,"/",mod, NULL)){
487  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
488  | 			goto unwindt;
489  | 		    }
490  | 		} else {
491  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t, len, mod, NULL)){
492  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
493  | 			goto unwindt;
494  | 		    }
495  | 		}
496  | 		/**
497  | 		 **  This is the recursion
498  | 		 **/
499  | 		Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, t, ver);
500  | 
501  | 		/**
502  | 		 **  Free our temporary prefix buffer
503  | 		 **/
504  | 		null_free((void *) &t);
505  | 		if (0) {	/* an error occurred */
506  | unwindt:
507  | 		    null_free((void *) &t);
508  | 		    goto unwind2;
509  | 		}
510  | 	    } 
511  | 	} else {     /** if( $path/$prefix/$mod is a directory) **/
512  | 	    /**
513  | 	     **  Now 'mod' should be either a file or the word 'default'
514  | 	     **  In case of default get the file with the highest verion number
515  | 	     **  in the current directory
516  | 	     **/
517  | 	    if( is_def) {
518  | 		if( !prefix)
519  | 		    prefix = ".";
520  | 		if( NULL == (filelist = SortedDirList( interp, path, prefix,
521  | 		&numlist)))
522  | 		    goto unwind1;
523  | 
524  | 		prefix = (char *) NULL;
525  | 		/**
526  | 		 **  Select the first one on the list which is either a
527  | 		 **  modulefile or another directory. We start at the highest
528  | 		 **  lexicographical name in the directory since the filelist
529  | 		 **  is reverse sorted.
530  | 		 **  If it's a directory, we delve into it.
531  | 		 **/
532  | 		for( i=0; i<numlist && Result==NULL; i++) {
533  | 		    /**
534  | 		     **  Build the full path name and check if it is a
535  | 		     **  directory. If it is, recursivly try to find there what
536  | 		     **  we're seeking for
537  | 		     **/
538  | 		    if ((char *)NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
539  | 			path, "/", filelist[i], NULL))
540  | 			    goto unwind2;
541  | 
542  | 		    if( !stat( fullpath, &stats) && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
543  | 			Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, prefix,
544  | 			    filelist[ i]);
545  | 		    } else {
546  | 			/**
547  | 			 **  Otherwise check the file for a magic cookie ...
548  | 			 **/
549  | 			if( check_magic( fullpath, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
550  | 			    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) 
551  | 			    Result = filelist[ i];
552  | 		    } /** if( !stat) **/
553  | 		} /** for **/
554  | 	    } else {  /** default **/
555  | 		/**
556  | 		 **  If mod names a file, we have to check wheter it exists and
557  | 		 **  is a valid module file
558  | 		 **/
559  | 		if( check_magic( fullpath, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
560  | 		    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) 
561  | 		    Result = mod;
562  | 		else {
563  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, fullpath, NULL);
564  | 		    Result = NULL;
565  | 		}
566  | 	    } /** if( mod is a filename) **/
567  | 	    /**
568  | 	     **  Build the full filename (using prefix and Result) if
569  | 	     **  Result is defined
570  | 	     **/
571  | 	    if( Result) {
572  | 		int len = strlen( Result) + 1;
573  | 
574  | 		if( prefix)
575  | 		    len += strlen( prefix) + 1;
576  | 
577  | 		if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, len, NULL))) {
578  | 		   ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
579  | 		   goto unwind2;
580  | 		}
581  | 		if( prefix) {
582  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t,len, prefix,"/",Result,NULL))
583  | 			goto unwindt2;
584  | 		} else {
585  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t,len, Result,NULL))
586  | 			goto unwindt2;
587  | 		}
588  | 		Result = t;
589  | 		if (0) {	/* an error occurred */
590  | unwindt2:
591  | 		    null_free((void *) &t);
592  | 		    goto unwind2;
593  | 		}
594  | 	    } 
595  | 	} /** mod is a file **/
596  |     } /** mod exists **/
597  |     /**
598  |      **  Free up temporary values and return what we've found
599  |      **/
600  |     null_free((void*) &fullpath);
601  |     null_free((void*) &s);
602  |     FreeList( filelist, numlist);
603  |     
604  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
605  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_GetModuleName, NULL);
606  | #endif
607  |     return( Result);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
608  | 
609  | unwind2:
610  |     null_free((void *) &fullpath);
611  | unwind1:
612  |     null_free((void *) &s);
613  | unwind0:
614  |     return(NULL);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
615  | 
616  | } /** End of 'GetModuleName' **/
617  | 
618  | /*++++
619  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
620  |  ** 									     **
621  |  **   Function:		SortedDirList					     **
622  |  ** 									     **
623  |  **   Description:	Checks the given path for the given modulefile.	     **
624  |  **			If the path + the module filename is the modulefile, **
625  |  **			then it is returned as the first element in the list.**
626  |  **			If the path + the module filename is a directory, the**
627  |  **			directory is read and sorted as the list.	     **
628  |  ** 									     **
629  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
630  |  ** 									     **
631  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
632  |  **			char		*path		Path to start seeking**
633  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module   **
634  |  **			int		*listcnt	Buffer to return the **
635  |  **							size of the created  **
636  |  **							list in elements     **
637  |  ** 									     **
638  |  **   Result:		char**		NULL	Any failure (alloc, param)   **
639  |  **					else	Base pointer to the newly    **
640  |  **						created list.		     **
641  |  **			*listcnt		Number of elements in the    **
642  |  **						list if one was created, un- **
643  |  **						changed otherwise	     **
644  |  ** 									     **
645  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
646  |  ** 									     **
647  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
648  |  ++++*/
649  | 
650  | char	**SortedDirList(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
651  | 		     		char		*path,
652  | 		     		char		*modulename,
653  | 		     		int		*listcnt)
654  | {
655  |     struct dirent	*file;		/** Directory entry		     **/
656  |     struct stat    	 stats;		/** Stat buffer			     **/
657  |     DIR			*subdirp;	/** Subdirectoy handle		     **/
658  |     char		*full_path;	/** Sugg. full path (path + module)  **/
659  |     char		**filelist;	/** Temp. base pointer of the list   **/
660  |     int			 i,		/** Number of entries in the subdir  **/
661  | 			 j,		/** Counts the number of list-entries**/
662  | 			 n,		/** Size of the allocated array	     **/
663  | 			 pathlen;	/** String length of 'fullpath'	     **/
664  |  
665  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
666  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_SortedDirList, NULL);
667  | #endif
668  |     /**
669  |      **  Allocate memory for the list to be created. Suggest a list size of
670  |      **  100 Elements. This may be changed later on.
671  |      **/
672  |     if( NULL == (filelist = (char**) calloc( n = 100, sizeof(char*))))
673  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
674  | 	    goto unwind0;
675  |     /**
676  |      **  Form the suggested module file name out of the passed path and 
677  |      **  the name of the module. Alloc memory in order to do this.
678  |      **/
679  |     if((char *) NULL == (full_path = stringer(NULL, 0,
680  | 	path,"/",modulename, NULL)))
681  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
682  | 	    goto unwind0;
683  |     pathlen = strlen(full_path);
684  |     
685  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
686  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "full_path='", full_path, "'", NULL);
687  | #endif
688  |     /**
689  |      **  Check whether this file exists. If it doesn't free up everything
690  |      **  and return on failure
691  |      **/
692  |     if( stat( full_path, &stats))
693  | 	goto unwind2;
694  |     /**
695  |      **  If the suggested module file is a regular one, we've found what we've
696  |      **  seeked for. Put it on the top of the list and return.
697  |      **/
698  |     if( S_ISREG( stats.st_mode)) {
699  | 	*listcnt = 1;
700  | 	filelist[0] = strdup( modulename);
701  | 
702  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
703  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "Module '", modulename, "' found", NULL);
704  | #endif
705  | 
706  | 	null_free((void*) &full_path);
707  | 	return( filelist);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (SUCCESS) --> **/
708  |     }
709  |     /**
710  |      **  What we've found is a directory
711  |      **/
712  |     if( S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
713  |         char	*tbuf;		/** Buffer for the whole filename for each   **/
714  | 				/** content of the directory		     **/
715  |         char	*mpath;		/** Pointer into *tbuf where to write the dir**/
716  | 				/** entry				     **/
717  | 
718  | 	/**
719  | 	 **  Open the directory for reading
720  | 	 **/
721  | 	if( NULL == (subdirp = opendir( full_path))) {
722  | #if 0
723  | 	/* if you can't open the directory ... is that really an error? */
724  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_OPENDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL))
725  | #endif
726  | 	    goto unwind2;
727  | 	}
728  | 	/**
729  | 	 **  Allocate a buffer for constructing complete file names
730  | 	 **  and initialize it with the directory part we do already know.
731  | 	 **/
732  |         if( NULL == (tbuf = stringer(NULL, MOD_BUFSIZE, full_path,"/", NULL)))
733  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
734  | 		goto unwind3;
735  | 
736  |         mpath = (tbuf + pathlen + 1);
737  | 	/**
738  | 	 **  Now scan all entries of the just opened directory
739  | 	 **/
740  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
741  | 	ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "Reading directory '", full_path, "'", NULL);
742  | #endif
743  | 	for( file = readdir( subdirp), i = 0, j = 0;
744  | 	     file != NULL;
745  | 	     file = readdir( subdirp), i++) {
746  | 	    /**
747  | 	     **  Oops! This one exceeds our array. Enlarge it.
748  | 	     **/
749  | 	    if( j == n)
750  | 		if( NULL == (filelist =
751  | 		    (char**) realloc((char*) filelist, n *= 2)))
752  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
753  | 			goto unwindt;
754  | 	    /**
755  | 	     **  Now, if we got a real entry which is not '.*' or '..' and
756  | 	     **  finally is not a temporary file (which are defined to end
757  | 	     **  on '~' ...
758  | 	     **/
759  | 	    if( file->d_name                && 
760  |                 *file->d_name != '.'        && 
761  |                 strcmp( file->d_name, "..")  &&
762  |                 file->d_name[ NLENGTH( file) - 1] != '~') {
763  | 		/**
764  | 		 **  ... build the full pathname and check for the magic
765  | 		 **  cookie or for another directory level in order to
766  | 		 **  validate this as a modulefile entry we're seeking for.
767  | 		 **/
768  |                 strcpy( mpath, file->d_name);
769  |                 if( check_magic( tbuf, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE,
770  | 			MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH) ||
771  | 		    !stat(tbuf, &stats) ) {
772  | 		    /**
773  | 		     **  Yep! Found! Put it on the list
774  | 		     **/
775  |                     if((char *) NULL == (filelist[j] = stringer(NULL,0,
776  | 			modulename,"/",file->d_name, NULL)))
777  | 			if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
778  | 			    goto unwindt;
779  | 		    j++;
780  |                 } /** if( mag. cookie or directory) **/
781  | 	    } /** if( not a dotfile) **/
782  | 	} /** for **/
783  | 	/**
784  | 	 **  Put a terminator at the lists end and then sort the list
785  | 	 **/
786  |         filelist[ j] = NULL;
787  | 	qsort( (void*) filelist, (size_t) j, sizeof(char*), filename_compare);
788  | 	/**
789  | 	 **  Free up temporary values ...
790  | 	 **/
791  | 	if( -1 == closedir( subdirp))
792  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL)) {
793  | 		goto unwind2;
794  | 	    }
795  | 	null_free((void*) &full_path);
796  | 	null_free((void*) &tbuf);
797  | 	/**
798  | 	 **  Set up return values and pass the created list to the caller
799  | 	 **/
800  | 	*listcnt = j;
801  | 	return( filelist);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (SUCCESS) --> **/
802  | 	
803  | 	if(0) {	
804  | unwindt:
805  | 	    null_free((void*) &tbuf);
806  | 	    goto unwind3;
807  | 	}
808  |     }
809  |     /**
810  |      **  If it is nor a regular file, neither a directory, we don't support
811  |      **  it at all ...
812  |      **/
813  | /** ??? What about links ??? **/
814  | 
815  | unwind3:
816  |     if( -1 == closedir( subdirp))
817  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL);
818  | unwind2:
819  |     null_free((void*) &full_path);
820  | unwind1:
821  |     FreeList( filelist, n);
822  | 
823  | unwind0:
824  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
825  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_SortedDirList, NULL);
826  | #endif
827  | 
828  |     return( NULL);			/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (FAILURE) --> **/
829  | 
830  | } /** End of 'SortedDirList' **/
831  | 
832  | /*++++
833  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
834  |  ** 									     **
835  |  **   Function:		SplitIntoList					     **
836  |  ** 									     **
837  |  **   Description: 	Splits a path-type environment variable into an array**
838  |  **			of char* list.					     **
839  |  ** 									     **
840  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
841  |  ** 									     **
842  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
843  |  **			char		*pathenv	Path to split 	     **
844  |  **			int		*numpaths	Buffer to write the  **
845  |  **							number of array ele- **
846  |  **							ments to.	     **
847  |  ** 									     **
848  |  **   Result:		char**		NULL	Any failure (alloc, param.)  **
849  |  **					else	Base pointer of the created  **
850  |  **						array			     **
851  |  **			*numpaths		Number of elements if an ar- **
852  |  **						ray has been created, unchan-**
853  |  **						ged otherwise.		     **
854  |  ** 									     **
855  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
856  |  ** 									     **
857  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
858  |  ++++*/
859  | 
860  | char	**SplitIntoList(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
861  | 		     		char		*pathenv, 
862  | 		     		int		*numpaths) 
863  | {
864  |     char	**pathlist = NULL;	/** Temporary base pointer for the   **/
865  | 					/** array to be created		     **/
866  |     char	 *givenpath = NULL;	/** Temporary buffer used to tokenize**/
867  | 					/** the passed input path	     **/
868  |     char	 *dirname = NULL;	/** Token pointer		     **/
869  |     int     	  i, 			/** Counts the number of elements    **/
870  | 		  n;			/** Size of the array		     **/
871  | 
872  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
873  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_SplitIntoList, NULL);
874  | #endif
875  |     /** 
876  |      **  Paramter check
877  |      **/
878  |     if( !pathenv)
879  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, "pathenv", NULL))
880  | 	    goto unwind0;
881  |     /**
882  |      **  Allocate space to copy in the value of the path value to
883  |      **  split. Thus this procedure doesn't change its input parameters.
884  |      **/
885  |     if( (char *) NULL == (givenpath = stringer(NULL,0, pathenv,NULL)))
886  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
887  | 	    goto unwind0;
888  |     /**
889  |      **  Allocate the list which is an array of char*.  n is used to
890  |      **  manage the array's growth if there are more than 100 paths in
891  |      **  the list.
892  |      **  Copy the passed path into the new buffer.
893  |      **/
894  |     if((char **) NULL == (pathlist = (char**) calloc( n = 100, sizeof( char*))))
895  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
896  | 	    goto unwind1;
897  |     /**
898  |      **  Split the given path environment variable into its components.
899  |      **/
900  |     for( i=0, dirname = strtok( givenpath, ": ");
901  |          dirname;
902  | 	 dirname = strtok( NULL, ": ")) {
903  | 	/**
904  | 	 **  Oops! The number of tokens exceed my array - reallocate it
905  | 	 **  and double its size!
906  | 	 **/
907  | 	if( i == n )
908  | 	    if((char **) NULL == (pathlist = (char**) realloc((char*) pathlist,
909  | 		n *= 2)))
910  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
911  | 		    goto unwind1;
912  | 	/**
913  | 	 **  Put the token into the array. Therefor a new area is allocated for
914  | 	 **  the token using 'xdup' - which expands 1 level of env.vars.
915  | 	 **/
916  | 	if( NULL == (pathlist[ i++] = xdup( dirname)))
917  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) {
918  | 		FreeList( pathlist, --i);
919  | 		goto unwind1;
920  | 	    }
921  |     } /** for **/
922  |     /**
923  |      **  Free up the temporary working array
924  |      **/
925  |     if( givenpath)
926  | 	null_free((void*) &givenpath);
927  |     /**
928  |      **  Set up the return value (Number of elements allocated) and pass
929  |      **  the arrays base pointer to the caller
930  |      **/
931  |     *numpaths = i;
932  |     return( pathlist);
933  | 
934  | unwind1:
935  |     null_free((void *) &givenpath);
936  | unwind0:
937  |     return( NULL);			/** -------- EXIT FAILURE -------> **/
938  | } /** End of 'SplitIntoList' **/
939  | 
940  | #ifndef FreeList
941  | 
942  | /*++++
943  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
944  |  ** 									     **
945  |  **   Function:		FreeList					     **
946  |  ** 									     **
947  |  **   Description:	Frees a char* array type list.			     **
948  |  ** 									     **
949  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
950  |  ** 									     **
951  |  **   Parameters:	char	**list		Pointer to the list	     **
952  |  **			int	  numelem	Number of elements in the    **
953  |  ** 						list			     **
954  |  **   Result:		-						     **
955  |  ** 									     **
956  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
957  |  ** 									     **
958  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
959  |  ++++*/
960  | 
961  | void FreeList(	char	**list,
962  | 		int	  numelem)
963  | {
964  |     register int j;
965  |     
966  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
967  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_FreeList, NULL);
968  | #endif
969  |     /**
970  |      **  Nothing to do ?
971  |      **/
972  |     if( !list)
973  | 	return;
974  |     /**
975  |      **  Free all elements of the list
976  |      **/
977  |     for( j = 0; j < numelem; j++)
978  | 	if( list[j] != NULL)
979  | 	    null_free((void *) (list + j));
980  |     /**
981  |      **  Free the entire list
982  |      **/
983  |     null_free((void *) &list);
984  | 
985  | } /** End of 'FreeList' **/
986  | 
987  | #endif
988  | 
989  | /*++++
990  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
991  |  ** 									     **
992  |  **   Function:		SourceRC					     **
993  |  ** 									     **
994  |  **   Description:	Source the passed global RC file		     **
995  |  ** 									     **
996  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
997  |  ** 									     **
998  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter	     **
999  |  **			char		*path		Path to be used      **
1000 |  **			char		*name		Name of the RC file  **
1001 |  **									     **
1002 |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Success		     **
1003 |  **					TCL_ERROR	Failure		     **
1004 |  **									     **
1005 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
1006 |  **					this function is called in order to  **
1007 |  **					control everything		     **
1008 |  ** 									     **
1009 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1010 |  ++++*/
1011 | 
1012 | int SourceRC( Tcl_Interp *interp, char *path, char *name)
1013 | {
1014 |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
1015 |     int 	  save_flags, i;
1016 |     char	 *buffer;
1017 |     int		  Result = TCL_OK;
1018 |     static char	**srclist = (char **) NULL;
1019 |     static int	  listsize = 0, listndx = 0;
1020 | 
1021 |     /**
1022 |      **  If there's a problem with the input parameters it means, that
1023 |      **  we do not have to source anything
1024 |      **  Only a valid TCL interpreter should be there
1025 |      **/
1026 |     if( !path || !name)
1027 | 	return( TCL_OK);
1028 | 
1029 |     if( !interp)
1030 | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
1031 |     /**
1032 |      **  Build the full name of the RC file
1033 |      **  Avoid duplicate sourcing
1034 |      **/
1035 |     if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, path,"/",name, NULL)))
1036 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1037 | 	    goto unwind0;
1038 |     for( i=0; i<listndx; i++)
1039 | 	if( !strcmp( srclist[ i], buffer))
1040 | 	    goto unwind1;
1041 |     /**
1042 |      **  Check whether the RC file exists and has the magic cookie inside
1043 |      **/
1044 |     if( !stat( buffer, &stats)) {
1045 | 	if( check_magic( buffer, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
1046 | 	    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) {
1047 | 	    /**
1048 | 	     **  Set the flags to 'load only'. This prevents from accidently
1049 | 	     **  printing something
1050 | 	     **/
1051 | 	    save_flags = g_flags;
1052 | 	    g_flags = M_LOAD;
1053 | 	    /**
1054 | 	     **  Source now
1055 | 	     **/
1056 | 	    if( TCL_ERROR == Execute_TclFile( interp, buffer)) 
1057 | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_SOURCE, LOC, buffer, NULL)) 
1058 | 		    Result = TCL_ERROR;
1059 | 	    g_flags = save_flags;
1060 | 	    /**
1061 | 	     **  Save the currently sourced file in the list
1062 | 	     **  Check whether the list is big enough to fit in a new entry
1063 | 	     **/
1064 | 	    if( !listsize) {
1065 | 		listsize = SRCFRAG;
1066 | 		if((char **) NULL == (srclist = (char **) malloc( listsize *
1067 | 		    sizeof( char **)))) {
1068 | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1069 | 		    goto unwind1;
1070 | 		}
1071 | 	    } else if( listndx + 1 >= listsize) {
1072 | 		listsize += SRCFRAG;
1073 | 		if((char **) NULL == (srclist = (char **) realloc( srclist, 
1074 | 		    listsize * sizeof( char **)))) {
1075 | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1076 | 		    goto unwind1;
1077 | 		}
1078 | 	    }
1079 | 	    /**
1080 | 	     **  Put the current RC files name on the list
1081 | 	     **/
1082 | 	    srclist[ listndx++] = buffer;
1083 | 
1084 | 	} else {
1085 | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, buffer, NULL);
1086 | 	    null_free((void *) &buffer);
1087 | 	}
1088 |     } /** if( !stat) **/
1089 |     /**
1090 |      **  Return our result
1091 |      **/
1092 |     return( Result);
1093 | 
1094 | unwind1:
1095 |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
1096 | unwind0:
1097 |     return( TCL_ERROR);
1098 | 
1099 | } /** End of 'SourceRC' **/
1100 | 
1101 | /*++++
1102 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1103 |  ** 									     **
1104 |  **   Function:		SourceVers					     **
1105 |  ** 									     **
1106 |  **   Description:	Source the '.version' file			     **
1107 |  ** 									     **
1108 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1109 |  ** 									     **
1110 |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter	     **
1111 |  **			char		*path		Path to be used      **
1112 |  **			char		*name		Name of the module   **
1113 |  **									     **
1114 |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Success		     **
1115 |  **					TCL_ERROR	Failure		     **
1116 |  **									     **
1117 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
1118 |  **					this function is called in order to  **
1119 |  **					control everything		     **
1120 |  ** 									     **
1121 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1122 |  ++++*/
1123 | 
1124 | int SourceVers( Tcl_Interp *interp, char *path, char *name)
1125 | {
1126 |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
1127 |     int save_flags;
1128 |     char *buffer;
1129 |     int Result = TCL_OK;
1130 |     char *version;
1131 |     char *new_argv[3];
1132 |     char *mod, *ver;
1133 | 
1134 |     /**
1135 |      **  If there's a problem with the input parameters it means, that
1136 |      **  we do not have to source anything
1137 |      **  Only a valid TCL interpreter should be there
1138 |      **/
1139 |     if( !path || !name)
1140 | 	return( TCL_OK);
1141 |     if( !interp)
1142 | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
1143 |     /**
1144 |      **  No default version defined so far?
1145 |      **/
1146 |     if( VersionLookup( name, &mod, &ver) &&
1147 | 	strcmp( ver, _default))
1148 | 	return( TCL_OK);
1149 |     /**
1150 |      **  Build the full name of the RC file and check whether it exists and
1151 |      **  has the magic cookie inside
1152 |      **/
1153 |     if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, path,"/",version_file,
1154 | 	NULL)))
1155 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1156 | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);
1157 |     if( !stat( buffer, &stats)) {
1158 | 	if(
1159 | #if VERSION_MAGIC != 0
1160 | 	    check_magic( buffer, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
1161 | 	    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)
1162 | #else
1163 | 	1
1164 | #endif
1165 | 	) {
1166 | 	    save_flags = g_flags;
1167 | 	    g_flags = M_LOAD;
1168 | 
1169 | 	    if( TCL_ERROR != (Result = Execute_TclFile( interp, buffer)) && 
1170 | 		(version = (char *) Tcl_GetVar(interp, "ModulesVersion", 0))) {
1171 | 		/**
1172 | 		 **  The version has been specified in the
1173 | 		 **  '.version' file. Set up the result code
1174 | 		 **/
1175 | 		null_free((void *) &buffer);
1176 | 		if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0,
1177 | 		name,"/",version, NULL)))
1178 | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1179 | 			return( TCL_ERROR);
1180 | 
1181 | 		new_argv[0] = "module-version";
1182 | 		new_argv[1] = buffer;
1183 | 		new_argv[2] = _default;
1184 | 		/**
1185 | 		 **  Define the default version
1186 | 		 **/
1187 | 		if( TCL_OK != cmdModuleVersion( (ClientData) 0,
1188 | 		    (Tcl_Interp *) NULL, 3, (CONST84 char **) new_argv)) {
1189 | 			Result = TCL_ERROR;
1190 | 		}
1191 | 	    } /** if( Execute...) **/
1192 | 
1193 | 	    g_flags = save_flags;
1194 | 
1195 | 	} else
1196 | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, buffer, NULL);
1197 | 
1198 |     } /** if( !stat) **/
1199 |     /**
1200 |      ** free buffer memory
1201 |      **/
1202 |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
1203 |     /**
1204 |      **  Result determines if this was successfull
1205 |      **/
1206 | 
1207 |     return( Result);
1208 | 
1209 | } /** End of 'SourceVers' **/
1210 |
